page.title: 13ELMINGTON, DESERTED VILLAGE
page.content: The name Elmington appears three times on the local 1:25,000 O.S. map. The name survives but the village does not. An estate or village existed in 1086. It belonged to Crowland Abbey which gradually enclosed the arable land for pasture from 1490. By 1720 all houses and buildings had gone. Pasture required less labourers and thus the village was depopulated. In our area several such desertions occured. The original names survive in houses, lodges or farms. These include Papley near Warmington, Hale near Apethorpe and Perio near Southwick. In 1985 the sites of such villages can be identified by crop-marks and strange earth-works, but aerial photography is the most effective way of locating a site. A more recent desertion just outside this block is the former RAF and USAF base at Polebrook.
